metadata.name: Potential Netcat Reverse Shell Execution
metadata.comment: Detects execution of netcat with the "-e" flag followed by common shells. This could be a sign of a potential reverse shell setup.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/nc')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/ncat'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -c ')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' -e '))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' bash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' bsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' csh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' ksh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' pdksh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' sh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower(' tcsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/ash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/bash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/bsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/csh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/ksh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/pdksh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/sh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/tcsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('/bin/zsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('$ifsash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('$ifsbash')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('$ifsbsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('$ifscsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('$ifsksh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('$ifspdksh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('$ifssh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('$ifstcsh')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('$ifszsh'))))

output.summary: Detects execution of netcat with the "-e" flag followed by common shells. This could be a sign of a potential reverse shell setup.
